title: INfinance
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: ‘I’m 15 years older’: My second wife says she will pass my estate onto my sons. What could go wrong?
items.description: “My wife is probably one of the most honest persons I’ve ever known.”

items.title: Overly bearish investors risk writing off 2025 too soon. These strategies offer upside and downside protection.
items.description: Ed Yardeni argues that, to match the doom and gloom from Wall Street bears, the stock market would need to see a Lehman-esque meltdown.

items.title: My husband will inherit $180K. I think we should invest the money. He wants to pay off his $168K mortgage. Who’s right?
items.description: “He has $15,000 in investments and $5,500 per month in disability income.”

items.title: Netflix wants to be a $1 trillion company. Earnings show why that’s a reasonable goal.
items.description: Analysts see Netflix generating growth even in a recession.

items.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
items.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.
